intro: Penstemon pubescens pygmaeus, commonly known as the dwarf beardtongue, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It features hairy, blue to purple flower spikes that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its nectar-rich flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
